Function Documentation

int rbxInitNexwayLib (  const char *  appName  )  [inline]
 

Loads and initializes the Nexway library using the specified app name and the default library and JAR paths.

Important:
This function (or rbxInitNexwayLibEx()) must be called by applications before any library functions can be called. Applications should verify that this function completes successfully (by checking the function's return value) in order to prevent accidental calls to NULL function pointers.
Parameters:
[in] appName optional app name to identify your application;
may be NULL
Returns:
RBX_E_LIB_LOAD_FAILURE if the Nexway library was not found or could not be loaded
RBX_E_LIB_FUNCTION_NOT_FOUND if the Nexway library was found, but a required function was not found
RBX_E_UNSUPPORTED_VERSION if the Nexway library was found, but its version was incompatible
RBX_E_JVM_INIT_FAILURE if the Java Virtual Machine could not be initialized
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxInitNexwayLibEx (  const char *  appName,
const char *  libPath,
const char *  jarPath
)  [inline]
 

Loads and initializes the Nexway library using the specified app name, library path and JAR path.

Warning:
This function is only for advanced users with special needs. Do not call this function unless you have a good reason to do so. Instead, use rbxInitNexwayLib().
Important:
This function (or rbxInitNexwayLib()) must be called by applications before any library functions can be called. Applications should verify that this function completes successfully (by checking the function's return value) in order to prevent accidental calls to NULL function pointers.
Parameters:
[in] appName optional app name to identify your application;
may be NULL
[in] libPath path to the Nexway library file;
may be NULL to use default path
[in] jarPath path to the Usbor JAR file;
may be NULL to use default path
Returns:
RBX_E_LIB_LOAD_FAILURE if the Nexway library was not found or could not be loaded
RBX_E_LIB_FUNCTION_NOT_FOUND if the Nexway library was found, but a required function was not found
RBX_E_UNSUPPORTED_VERSION if the Nexway library was found, but its version was incompatible
RBX_E_JVM_INIT_FAILURE if the Java Virtual Machine could not be initialized
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxLib_setJvm (  const char *  jvmLibPath  ) 
 

Sets the path to the JVM library.

Warning:
This function is only for advanced users with special needs. Do not call this function unless you have a good reason to do so.

This function must be called before calling rbxLib_initJvm(). The proper way to modify JVM settings is to copy the NexwayLib header file, rbxNexwayLib.h, and edit the inline function rbxInitNexwayLibEx().

Examples:
    (Windows) - rbxLib_setJvm( "C:\\jdk1.4\\jre\\bin\\client\\jvm.dll" );
    (Linux)   - rbxLib_setJvm( "/usr/java/1.4/jre/lib/i386/client/libjvm.so" );
    (Mac OSX) - rbxLib_setJvm( "/System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Versions/1.4.1/Libraries/libjvm.dylib" );
Parameters:
[in] jvmLibPath absolute path to the JVM library.
Returns:
#RBX_E_JVM_NOT_FOUND if the specified JVM libarary was not found

generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxLib_setJvmClassPath (  const char *  classpath  ) 
 

Sets the classpath to be used by the JVM.

Warning:
This function is only for advanced users with special needs. Do not call this function unless you have a good reason to do so.

This function must be called before calling rbxLib_initJvm(). The proper way to modify JVM settings is to copy the NexwayLib header file, rbxNexwayLib.h, and edit the inline function rbxInitNexwayLibEx().

Parameters:
[in] classpath the classpath for the JVM to use
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxLib_addJvmOption (  const char *  option  ) 
 

Adds an option to the JVM invocation.

Warning:
This function is only for advanced users with special needs. Do not call this function unless you have a good reason to do so.

This function must be called before calling rbxLib_initJvm(). The proper way to modify JVM settings is to copy the NexwayLib header file, rbxNexwayLib.h, and edit the inline function rbxInitNexwayLibEx().

Examples:
    rbxLib_addJvmOption( "-Xmn8m" );
    rbxLib_addJvmOption( "-Xmx32m" );
Parameters:
[in] option the JVM option to add
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxLib_addJvmProperty (  const char *  property,
const char *  value
) 
 

Adds a Java system property to the JVM invocation.

Warning:
This function is only for advanced users with special needs. Do not call this function unless you have a good reason to do so.

This function must be called before calling rbxLib_initJvm(). The proper way to modify JVM settings is to copy the NexwayLib header file, rbxNexwayLib.h, and edit the inline function rbxInitNexwayLibEx().

Example:
    rbxLib_addJvmProperty( "swing.defaultlaf", "javax.swing.plaf.metal.MetalLookAndFeel" );
Parameters:
[in] property the name of the system property
[in] value the value of the system property
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxLib_initJvm (  const char *  appName  ) 
 

Initializes the JVM and creates a Nexway using the specified app name.

Warning:
This function is only for advanced users with special needs. Do not call this function unless you have a good reason to do so.

This function should not really be called directly. The proper way to modify JVM settings is to copy the NexwayLib header file, rbxNexwayLib.h, and edit the inline function rbxInitNexwayLibEx().
